archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Additional Michael Ryan Papers, Accession #10963-a , Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Michael Ryan of Santa Monica, California, loaned this addition to his papers to the Library through Charles Verrill, Liz Darhansoff Agency, New York, New York, on September 4, 1991, without restrictions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This addition to the papers of poet Michael Ryan of Santa Monica, California, contain ca. 1,675 items (9 Hollinger boxes, ca. 4 linear feet), ca. 1968-1989, and include manuscripts and typescripts of his poetry; notes; lectures; articles; correspondence; printed matter; teaching materials used in Ryan's literature and poetry classes at Southern Methodist University and Goddard College, and manuscripts by other poets.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The first series of manuscripts by Michael Ryan consists of poems, articles, lectures, and miscellaneous manuscripts. The poems form the first subseries and each poem with all of its various drafts is foldered separately and arranged alphabetically by title. Any drafts of poems found in the previous Ryan accession (10963) were interfiled in that collection to keep the various drafts together. The second subseries contains drafts and notes for many of the same articles and lectures found in accession # 10963, and two drafts of his book of poetry, In Winter. New items include an interview with Michael Ryan published in Fiction and notes concerning "Poets on Poetry: An Annotated Checklist" and "Rhythm and Prosody." Also present in this series are several screenplays and short stories by Michael Ryan.

The second series contains Ryan's teaching files for classes at Goddard College and Southern Methodist University, recommendations for students and colleagues, grant applications submitted by Ryan, contracts, letters concerning employment, biographical information, and printed material about Ryan's career.

Correspondence with other poets, colleagues, and friends comprises the third series. Correspondents who have written more than two or three letters have their own folder and are listed individually in the box listing. Other correspondents are filed in two general correspondence folders but are listed by name in the box listing.

The fourth series consists of manuscripts by other authors, including interviews with Robert Penn Warren and Robert Hass, and poems by Stephen Dobyns, Tess Gallagher, Reginald Gibbons, Louise Gluck, Robert Hass, Thomas Lux, and Dennis Schmitz.

scopecontent.p: Correspondents include: Steve Orlen; Gregory Orr; Robert Pinsky; David Remnick; Nate Scaglione; Elinor Schmitz; Michael Sheridan; Martin Shockley; Maura Stanton; Jody Stewart; Leslie Z. Tobin; Robert Penn Warren; Robert H. Winner; Tobias Wolff; and Ellen Voigt
